comments.commentBody: Why did it take so long for The Times to run this story? Had to think of a logical story? I see no reason why Trump tweet is false, unfortunately.
Take off your blinders
A president does not have authority to order wiretaps. Only a judge does. That's why it's false.

Then you are very likely one of the non-thinkers who gave us Swamp Thing. The truth of what the NYT is reporting has absolutely nothing to do with how long it took them to report it.
.
Swamp Thing's tweet offers nothing more than an unsubstantiated claim, which describes 90% of what Swamp Thing has ever said. He is a liar, a cheat, and a rat. And you believe him.

We have come to this. Not Trump; he is a symptom of the greater malaise. The American system of governance has gone the way, and to the same extent, of the American economy that once offered Hope for the world's Everyman and Everywoman. Who will put it back together again? It is more than merely cracked or chipped. It is shattered. Witness the President's behavior on a Saturday morning before dawn. O how the heart aches.

JO, you are right -- the "greater malaise" is not Trump himself, but the fact that he has so many followers. Without them, he would be merely another obnoxious player in the Real Estate game. But let me continue.

The singular "malaise" of the past century is the one which has been glibly characterized as "alienation," which has had three distinct (if overlapping) meanings based upon whether one approaches it from a Marxist, Freudian, or more generally sociological perspective. I view it from the premise that we humans, who evolved as self-aware and self-concerned individuals living in small groups, are simply overwhelmed by the scope, magnitude, complexity, and invasiveness of modern institutions. Our response, which does not essentially vary across "demographic" categories, has been to retreat back into our small-group mentality.

As Marx wrote, "all that was solid melts into air, all that was sacred is profaned." To which, let me add my own gem -- "the category of the Sacred is the apotheosis of obscurantism."
comments.userLocation: Way Out West between Broadway and Philadelphia

comments.commentBody: No Steve Bannon is.

Of course Obama did this--masterminded, of course, from his secret ancestral lair in Kenya...

Next week they will be rubberizing the Oval Office.
Andy Borowitz in the New Yorker reports that D.T. has already covered all the White House phones in tin-foil!  :)
17 intelligence agencies said so.  There's your evidence.
That's the bully Trump's MO, like when he screeched that Clinton was a "bigot". Total schoolyard stuff – can't wait till he hits puberty and gets all moody...
The evidence is obvious. Flynn and sessions lied. No question and no doubt.

Bravo for all the truthful comments about our newest chief executive.
And god help us deal with the national shame of it all.

The New York Times is playing right into Trump's hands. Of course the allegation is ridiculous--even Trump surely knows that it is ridiculous. Yet, in 140 characters or less, he pokes NYT into a 2,000 word article repeating what we have all known for a very long time: Trump says outrageous and ridiculous things. The resulting story is always negative, as it should be, which allows Trump to claim he's being bashed by a biased media (and a careful reading of this story does reveal bias, not the least being allowing an anonymous source to day that Trump owes the nation an apology. Anonymous sources shouldn't be allowed to state opinions).

So, here we go all over again. Trump behaving like a six year old is the new normal. Get used to it. The best thing to do with a six year old in the midst of a tantrum is to ignore him, which is what the media should be doing in cases like this.

Unfortunately, this 6 year old child is the President of the United States, and thus cannot be ignored.  If the mainstream media didn't write about him, then we'd be left only with the impressions of Breitbart news.
I'm with you. Every day I hope for his impeachment. I'm ashamed to be an American these days.

It doesn't take much at all to yank Trump's chain.  Far from being the big deal deal maker, he's easily controlled by others.  Add to that his insecurities and his general imbalance, and we have a clear and present danger.  Now that the media folks are done with gushing about being "presidential," perhaps we can get back to serious reporting and analysis.
Trump needs to get over the fact that he won and start uhm....governing??  NOT SEXY!!  SAD!!
What sort of evidence would you accept as having credibility? Answer: none.
There is absolutely NO evidence that Trump Towers was tapped. Do you think Trump had no Security? EE Gods!

Dear Mr. Putin:

This does not reflect on you well. We know you installed the current president. That's pretty impressive--we'll have to give that to you.

However, you've clearly lost your touch. With over 300 million people to choose from, is this really the best you could do? Your reputation for shrewd decisions is taking a big blow.

President Obama is a man of integrity, who values the law as it relates to all citizens, including Donald Trump. President Trump's outrageous statements are about himself. Perhaps he should look to his buddy Putin, an individual who relishes spying on everyone, as he was taught as a KBG agent.

The NSA was tapping all the Russian agents coming and going from Trump Tower...

Good...that's their job...
Yes he gave a speech.  He read from a teleprompter what was written by some 36 year old.  Big accomplishment.  And so many fell for it.  Amazing.

The evidence is that the Russians hacked ONLY the DNC and then drip, drip, dripped the data they stole over a period of months in order to cause maximum, prolonged damage to one party only.

Got it now? You can read all about it in the back issues of the NYTimes.

And then there is Comey. Was he bought off by a promise he could stay in his job?

This Trump Presidency just keeps getting nuttier and nuttier. And where are the Republicans with their "values"? Please, one of you so-called leaders of the Republican right wing who professes to care about America, step up to a microphone and demand that President Trump stops acting like a toddler. Otherwise, you're with him and the wrong side of history.

Liberals are always trying to make trouble for Trump, and here they go again. Trump learned of the Obama wiretap from an extremely reliable source: his good friend Jim. What do you have to say now liberals?

Hi Socrates,
I was being satirical. I'm a liberal Democrat.
Leo was being sarcastic. Note the "good friend Jim": it's satirical.

Obama didn't wiretap baby donnie, he didn't have the authority.  Where is the proof he ordered it?  Obama should sue him for libel.  Baby donnie is his own worst enemy.  But you will understand none of this as your head is too far up his butt.

"... projection; meaning he makes charges he himself could own."

Projection! That's the word I was looking for. I like "bad (or sick)" better -- though "bad *and* sick" is probably closer to the truth.

Thanks, Frank! So many people today are so pretentious with their diets, shaming those of us with more pedestrian gastronomical tastes.

If I eat sensibly most of the time, I don't feel guilty about an occasional Krispy Kreme. While growing up, the only way I could eat spinach was with mustard on it. Fortunately my parents cared more about my eating the spinach than what condiment I chose to slather on it.

Let's not shame Trump for ketchup on a steak. Let's challenge him on his policies instead.

I'm a very clean eater who cooks nearly every meal at home on a 70% paleo diet. My meat comes from small family farms and the chickens who lay my eggs have probably seen Radiohead in concert, but a couple times a year I oblige when someone requests my famous Krispy Kreme bread pudding.

Honestly, I think people who are so rigid about food would be healthier and happier if they'd just lighten up and eat something trashy once in a while.
Care to share the recipe for your Krispy Kreme bread pudding? Sounds decadent but delicious....might provide a tasty break from all that kale in my fridge! :)

Trump senses his supporters want to be lied to. His supporters find the established political order has nothing for them and see the people in the corporate world and from other countries as undeserving of what they do get.
So the Trump supporters need an alternative reality, which Trump gives them, to justify a new set of national priorities. They sense it might be short-lived, so they want to get while the gettin' is good. But the more insane tweets we get from Trump, the shallower is his support in Congress. The report that Trump blew his stack at Session's realistic self-recusal likely means either that Trump lacks a sense of reality OR has the sense that the hounds are closing in on his complicity in the Russian's hacking in the election, which if proven, would result in his stepping down from the Presidency, either voluntarily or not.
When will this nightmare end? When can chaos subside? When can conservatives come to their senses and start behaving as real humans?
